u28.title: Transaction Limit Exceeded
u28.explanation: You have crossed your daily UPI transaction limit set by your bank. Banks in India typically allow Rs 1-2 lakh per day depending on your account type.
reasons: You exceeded the daily transaction limit
Your bank has a lower limit for your account type
next_steps: Wait until midnight for the limit to reset
Use a different bank account or payment method
Contact your bank to request a limit increase
scenarios: Error occurs when sending money multiple times in a day
Common during festival seasons or high usage days
Happens after multiple bill payments in one day

u30.title: Debit Failed at Bank
u30.explanation: Your bank was unable to debit money from your account. This usually means there's an issue with your bank account or the bank's systems.
next_steps: Check your account balance
Ensure your bank account is active
Try again after some time
Contact your bank if the issue persists
scenarios: Occurs when bank systems are under maintenance
Common during month-end when servers are busy
Happens if account has pending verification

u16.title: Risk Threshold Exceeded
u16.explanation: Your transaction was flagged as potentially risky by the bank's security system. This is a safety measure to protect you from fraud.
reasons: Transaction to a new or unverified recipient
next_steps: Wait for 24 hours and try again
Make a smaller transaction first
Contact your bank to whitelist the recipient
scenarios: Triggered when sending large amounts to new contacts
Common after multiple wrong PIN attempts
Happens when transaction pattern differs from usual

u67.title: Timeout - No Response from Bank
u67.explanation: The bank did not respond within the expected time. Your money is safe - if debited, it will be refunded within 24-48 hours.
reasons: Bank server is slow or overloaded
next_steps: Check your account - money may not have been debited
Wait for auto-refund if debited (usually 24-48 hours)
Avoid retrying immediately to prevent double payment
scenarios: Common during salary days when bank traffic is high
Occurs frequently on 1st and 15th of month
Happens during evening peak hours 6-9 PM

u69.title: Account Blocked or Frozen
u69.explanation: Your bank account is currently blocked or frozen for UPI transactions. This could be a temporary security measure.
reasons: Account is under verification by the bank
KYC documents are pending or expired
Suspicious activity detected on the account
next_steps: Contact your bank branch immediately
Complete any pending KYC verification
Check for any SMS or email from your bank
scenarios: Occurs after multiple failed login attempts
Common if KYC has expired
Happens when account shows unusual activity

xh.title: Invalid UPI Handle/ID
xh.explanation: The UPI ID you entered is either incorrect or does not exist. Please double-check the recipient's UPI address.
reasons: The UPI ID has been deactivated
Wrong format used (should be like name@bank)
next_steps: Verify the UPI ID with the recipient
Check for typos or extra spaces
Ask recipient for an alternative UPI ID
scenarios: Common when typing UPI ID manually
Occurs when recipient changed their UPI ID
Happens with old or unused UPI addresses

zt.title: Invalid Transaction Format
zt.explanation: The transaction details were not in the correct format required by the UPI system.
reasons: Technical glitch in the UPI app
Outdated version of the payment app
next_steps: Update your UPI app to the latest version
Clear app cache and try again
Try a different UPI app
scenarios: Occurs with outdated app versions
Common after app updates with bugs
Happens when switching between apps mid-transaction

bank-declined.title: Transaction Declined by Bank
bank-declined.explanation: Your bank has declined this transaction. This is a general rejection that can happen for various reasons.
reasons: Transaction blocked by bank's fraud detection
next_steps: Check your account balance and status
Contact your bank's customer care
Try again after some time
Use a different payment method
scenarios: Common with international bank accounts
Occurs when daily limits are reached
Happens with new or unverified accounts

am04.title: Insufficient Funds
am04.explanation: You don't have enough balance in your account to complete this transaction. Remember to account for any minimum balance requirements.
reasons: Account balance is less than transaction amount
next_steps: Add money to your account
Check for any pending/hold amounts
Reduce the transaction amount
scenarios: Common at end of month when balance is low
Occurs when minimum balance is blocked
Happens when EMI or auto-debit is pending

b1.title: Beneficiary Bank Unavailable
b1.explanation: The recipient's bank is currently not responding or is under maintenance. Your money has not been deducted.
next_steps: Wait 15-30 minutes and try again
Ask recipient if their bank is facing issues
Try sending to a different account of the same person
scenarios: Common during scheduled bank maintenance windows
Occurs frequently with smaller banks
Happens during system upgrades
